content: By: Matthew Barby January 15, 2014 The Power of Authors and Content for Link Building Link Building Traditional guest blogging campaigns start by finding websites on which they'd like to post. To build better links, I'd suggest turning that around, and focusing first on finding the right authors and influencers. Read this post By: Jess Champion December 16, 2013 An Eight-Step Plan to Get PR-Driven Links Link Building Building high-profile links from media sources isn't that difficult when you know how to approach journalists with a good story. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard November 19, 2013 Why Bad Linkbait Needs to Die: How Linkable Assets Deliver 10x More Value Link Building Bad linkbait is the scourge of the Internet. It wastes our time, money, and our audience's attention. A growing problem with poorly executed linkbait is the risk it creates for your SEO and the hidden costs of creating less-than-stellar content. What's the solution? We love good linkable assets. Let's explore why linkable assets deliver 10 times more value for your SEO dollar. Read this post By: Arjun Rajkumar November 11, 2013 Link Building Ideas to Get More Customers Link Building Are you trying to get more customers to your website? Do you want to create more buzz online? If you said yes to these two questions - then this blog post is for you. Read this post By: Brady Callahan November 7, 2013 Using Google Plus: A Guide for Local Businesses Link Building Google+ provides a multitude of benefits for individuals and companies looking to promote unique content and help better optimize their website for organic search. But when most small-to-medium sized business owners think of using social media or having a content marketing strategy, Google+ is forgotten and almost always left behind. Read this post By: Sam Miranda October 29, 2013 Case Study: White-Hat Link Building in the Gambling Industry Link Building White-hat link building (an admittedly contentious term) is possible. In this post I’m going to outline four strategies that I have obtained from my experiences of content marketing, specifically guest posting (for want of a better term) for a gambling affiliate website. Read this post By: Jon Culshaw October 8, 2013 "Real Company Shit" with Nothing More than Leftover Timber Link Building Great feats of content marketing and SEO don't always come from expected places. This post details the story of a woodworker in the UK who, after seeing the MozCon presentation from Wil Reynolds, set out to do some "real company shit" of his own. Read this post By: Kaila Strong October 3, 2013 Guide to Using Unlinked Brand Mentions for Link Acquisition Link Building Many tout link building as one of the hardest parts of the SEO process. Sure, with spammed to death tactics not being valued any longer (thanks to Panda and Penguin) and seemingly low hanging fruit obliterated I could see some thinking link building is hardest. But after years of manual link building, strategy and analysis as well as training link builders, I’ve come to the conclusion that many of us can build good links when we try hard enough. It requires diligence, outside-the-box thinking, effort and some marketing chops. Oh and the finely honed ability to find just about anything on the internet. Read this post By: Jason Acidre September 17, 2013 12 Scalable Link-Building Tactics Link Building Through all the debates about link-building and link-earning, one thing is clear: High-quality links are still an essential part of any SEO strategy. This post offers 12 of today's most effective and scalable tactics to build your link portfolio. Read this post By: Moosa Hemani September 13, 2013 How I build Links by Offering Free Logo Identity Link Building Guest blogging, broken link building and good outreach does help but I had to do something extraordinary to bring quality links that point back to my client’s website. I tried something that really works well for me; not only I get some good links from quality websites but also managed to get considerable reputation and connections with other peers in the industry. Read this post By: Marie Haynes August 14, 2013 What is an Unnatural Link? An in-depth Look at the Google Quality Guidelines Link Building Do you know how to recognize an unnatural link? Sometimes unnatural links are easy to spot. But, other times they are not. In this article we will take an in depth look at the link schemes section of the Google Quality Guidelines and discuss what this document says in regards to unnatural links. Along the way I will share some of my experiences in dealing with websites who have been given unnatural links penalties. Read this post By: Will Stevens July 23, 2013 Beyond PageRank: Five Alternative Factors for Evaluating Outreach Prospects Link Building Here are five less conventional factors you should take into account when assessing sites for outreach purposes. Read this post By: Brandon Hassler July 18, 2013 9 Leads to Healthy Link Building Link Building Anybody who has been in digital marketing for more than six months can see that things have evolved dramatically in the past year. With the roll out of Penguin in 2012 and now Penguin 2.0, hopefully it has been a wakeup call to many on how careful you need to be in your link building tactics. While the... Read this post By: Carson Ward July 15, 2013 7 Reasons to Remove "Link Building" from Our Vocabulary Link Building It may seem insane to many in the industry to speak of discarding "link building" as an action, goal, or job description; but after years of consulting, dozens of penalty-related questions in Moz’s Q&A, and careful consideration, I am convinced that the idea of "building links" has been heartbreakingly detrimental to our industry and many site owners. I will argue that everyone — marketers and SEOs included — would be better off if we stopped talking about building links altogether. Read this post
